title: Palchak (UC Davis) Rule for Pediatric Head Trauma
desc: The Palchak (UC Davis) Rule for Pediatric Head Trauma identifies children at low risk for brain injuries after blunt head trauma.

orgreference.text: Palchak MJ, Holmes JF, Vance CW, et al. A decision rule for identifying children at low risk for brain injuries after blunt head trauma. Ann Emerg Med. 2003;42(4):492-506.

other_refer.text: Palchak MJ, Holmes JF, Kuppermann N. Clinician judgment versus a decision rule for identifying children at risk of traumatic brain injury on computed tomography after blunt head trauma. Pediatr Emerg Care. 2009;25(2):61-5.

data.evidence:
If any of the following is present, then the patient is NOT low risk for brain injury:

  1. Abnormal mental status
  2. Clinical signs of skull fracture
  3. History of vomiting
  4. Scalp hematoma (in children ≤2 years of age)
  5. Headache

inputs.label_en: Possible fracture to the skull that is open or depressed.
inputs.name: skull
